section.title: Install KVM and qemu software
section.para: In this section we discuss how the KVM/qemu software is installed on the host system.

The KVM/qemu software is part of the Fedora 20 yum repository. Check with yum repolist if the host is configured to use this repository.
&hostp; yum repolist Loaded plugins: fastestmirror, langpacks, refresh-packagekit Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile * fedora: mirror.1000mbps.com * rpmfusion-free: mirror.proserve.nl * rpmfusion-free-updates: mirror.proserve.nl * rpmfusion-nonfree: mirror.proserve.nl * rpmfusion-nonfree-updates: mirror.proserve.nl * updates: mirror.1000mbps.com repo id repo name status !adobe-linux-x86_64 Adobe Systems Incorporated 2 fedora/20/x86_64 Fedora 20 - x86_64 38,597 rpmfusion-free/20/x86_64 RPM Fusion for Fedora 20 - Free 468 !rpmfusion-free-updates/20/x86_64 RPM Fusion for Fedora 20 - Free - Up 322 rpmfusion-nonfree/20/x86_64 RPM Fusion for Fedora 20 - Nonfree 203 !rpmfusion-nonfree-updates/20/x86_64 RPM Fusion for Fedora 20 - Nonfree - 205 !updates/20/x86_64 Fedora 20 - x86_64 - Updates 15,775 repolist: 55,572

Next, we do the installation:
&hostp; yum install qemu-kvm .. output skipped .. Package 2:qemu-kvm-1.6.2-1.fc20.x86_64 already installed and latest version Nothing to do
After the KVM software is installed, we need to ensure that the service is on:
&hostp; systemctl list-unit-files | grep virt libvirt-guests.service disabled libvirtd.service enabled virtlockd.service static virtlockd.socket disabled
Important to see here is that libvirtd.service is enabled.

The host is now ready to run KVM guest systems. To make it possible to configure guests, we need extra software, in the form of RPM packages, virt-manager and virt-install.
&hostp; yum install virt-manager virt-install .. output skipped ..

We want the KVM guest systems to be in the same network as the host system. This means that we need to configure bridging on the host. The following steps are needed:
removal of the host physical interface
creation of a Bridge interface on the host
addition of the physical host interface to the bridge

Make sure to become root with: sudo su - or su -. From the command line, start the program nm-connection-editor. Remove the Ethernet interface em1, or whatever the physical interface is called on the host.
